reviewText: Hollow Man112 minAction/Sci-Fi/ThrillerAugust 4, 2000USADirector: Paul VerhoevenWriters: Gary Scott Thompson - story, Andrew W. Marlowe - storyStars: Elisabeth Shue, Kevin Bacon, Josh BrolinTwice as much Hollow Man and a decent price.  The first Hollow Man is worth the price alone, and it's just as well since the second Hollow isn't on the same level.  Hollow Man is a new take on the invisible man story.  The special effects are far better.  Kevin Bacon and Elisabeth Shue are great.  Bacon plays the scientist that becomes invisible and crazy in the process.  Well worth seeing and owning for this price under $8.Hollow Man II91 minAction/Horror/Sci-FiJune 20, 2006CanadaDirector: Claudio FähWriters: Gary Scott Thompson, Andrew W. MarloweStars: Christian Slater, Peter Facinelli, Laura ReganChristian Slater plays a soldier that is used in an experimant and once he becomes invisible, like Bacon in the first Hollow, he goes off the deep end.  He hunts those responsible to kill them.  Decent but no where near as good as the first Hollow.After all these years since Claude Rains went wacky when he became invisible you'd think they would learn.Recommendations:Memoirs of an Invisible Man (1992),The Invisible Man, andAbbott and Costello Meet the Invisible ManCA Luster
summary: Hollow Man & Hollow Man 2 - Blu-ray Double Feature
Title: Hollow Man / Hollow Man 2 (Double Feature)

reviewText: This was a parody of a Sci-fi  classic  but Kevin Beacon turns in a pretty good performance that actually makes you forget the original movie and you begin t truly follow  the plot of this production.  I can honestly say that I enjoyed this remake and was glad to find in this back to back form which makes me feel like this was a good find!!!!!Rodney
Title: Hollow Man / Hollow Man 2 (Double Feature)

reviewerName: Jason P. Pumphrey "the movie & music man"
reviewText: Hollow Man is a great film directed by the great Paul Verhoeven.Hollow Man 2 is a subpar sequel, and nowhere as good as the classic original.The PQ and AG are pretty good, plus it's nice getting BOTH Hallow Man films on one blu-ray disc, courtesy of Mill Creek.Recommended for fans of the Hallow Man films.
summary: one great film, and one mediocre film.
Title: Hollow Man / Hollow Man 2 (Double Feature)

reviewText: A 2 film value pack for lovers of sci-fi. A great storyline revolving around an experimental serum that turns people invisible, along with homicidal and crazy. Awesome special effects as well.
Title: Hollow Man / Hollow Man 2 (Double Feature)

reviewText: Okay normally I don't try to buy the off brand tapes on BLU RAY, but I took a chance and it paid off. I had the original SONY BLU RAY of Part 1 and loved it. Now I got both together and think its the best the BLU RAY in my set. If you like just HOLLOW MAN and not HOLLOW MAN 2 buy this anyway five bucks is worth it.
Title: Hollow Man / Hollow Man 2 (Double Feature)

reviewText: 2 fer 1 almost always has a catch, the soundtrack for hollow man 1 is the problem with this disc! keep your original blu-ray of the first hollow man if you buy this version to get hollow man 2.

Title: Hollow Man / Hollow Man 2 (Double Feature)

reviewText: Kevin Bacon is the show (sometimes we forget how very very good he is) in the first of these and his performance makes the movie rise above it's 'B' origins.  He is fascinating to watch and really cuts his teeth on his fellow actors feeding into his descent into madness.  This is a classic on a par with Claude Rains' magnificent original Invisible Man.  Paul Verhoeven has been a hit or miss director his whole career...but when he hits he hits and this one proves it beyond a shadow of a doubt.  But then there is no shadow...is there....and certainly no doubt that this is a great movie. Five StarsChristian Slater (a much underrated actor) carries the sequel with aplomb but the script keeps him from attaining Bacon's acidity and the story becomes a Verhoeven action wanderer rather than a focus on character and story (mostly misses when he does this).  It's good but not great.  Yet Slater is always fascinating to watch and he does what he does within the confines of this story and direction with his usual unique take on things.  I enjoyed it.  Three Stars for the movie - Four Stars for Slater's work here.Having them both on the same blu-ray with upgraded sound and picture that looks great is a plus.  Having zero extras is a bummer for some but I don't think I've ever watched an extra on any blu-ray I own and I own 1285 of them as of this writing.  I have approximately 15 to 20 years of life left at the outside and I want to fill it with the entertainment movies offer without shattering my suspension of belief by learning how the craftsmen go about their work.  But that's just me and I know there are those who live for the extras so be warned.All in all one great update and one good take on the old Invisible Man story that should be in any movie library.
Title: Hollow Man / Hollow Man 2 (Double Feature)

reviewText: Happy With this movie.  I like the 1st movie but not the biggest fan of the second.  Worth the price and the high def is average for a up converted movie.  Same with the #2.
Title: Hollow Man / Hollow Man 2 (Double Feature)
